1:
Yahweh, I will praise you with all of my inner being.\q2 I will tell others about all the wonderful things that you have done.
\q1
2:
I will sing to celebrate what you, who are much greater than all other gods, have done.


\q1
3:
When my enemies realize that you are very powerful,\q2 they stumble, and then they are killed.
\q1
4:
You sit on your throne to judge people,\q2 and you have judged fairly concerning me.


\q1
6:
Our enemies have disappeared;\q2 you destroyed their cities,
\q2 and people do not even remember them anymore.



\q1
7:
But Yahweh rules forever.\q2 He judges people while he sits on his throne.
\q1
8:
He will judge all the people in the world justly;\q2 he will be fair when he judges the people of every nation.


\q1
9:
Yahweh will be a refuge for those who are oppressed;\q2 he will be like a shelter for them when they have trouble.
\q1
10:
Those who know Yahweh trust in him;\q2 he never abandons those who come to him for help.



\q1
11:
Yahweh rules on Mount Zion;\q2 praise him and sing to him.
\q1 Tell the people of all the nations the marvelous things that he has done.
\q1
12:
He does not forget to punish those who have murdered others;\q2 he will punish them,
\q2 and he will not ignore people who are crying because they are suffering.



\q1
13:
Yahweh, act mercifully toward me!\q1 Look at the ways that my enemies have injured me.
\q2 Do not allow me to die because of these injuries.
\q1
14:
I want to live in order that I can praise you at the gates of Jerusalem\q2 and to rejoice because you rescued me.


\q1
15:
It is as though the wicked people of many nations have dug a pit for me to fall into,\q2 but they have fallen into that same pit.
\q1 It is as though they have spread out a net to catch me,
\q2 but their feet have been caught in that same net.
\q1
16:
Because of what you have done, people know that you make justice happen;\q2 you allow wicked people to be trapped by the same evil things that they themselves do.



\q1
17:
Wicked people will all die and be buried in their graves;\q2 their spirits will go to be with all those who have forgotten about you.
\q1
18:
But you will not forget those who are needy;\q2 what they confidently expect will never be in vain.



\q1
20: Yahweh, teach them that they must be afraid of you and honor you.\q2 Cause them to know that they are only human beings.
